    Ensure that pedigree data frame column only contains allowed values

    forcingNA_ifnot_contains.Rd

    Used to check categorical and logical columns in checkFam.

    forcingNA_ifnot_contains(
  ped,
  col_spec,
  allowed,
  default_NA_rep = NULL,
  NA_Ok = TRUE,
  vec = NULL,
  force_NA = TRUE,
  force_remove = FALSE
)

    Arguments

    ped

    A pedigree data frame.

    col_spec

    The name of a column if ped with a specific attribute.

    allowed

    A vector of the values that are allowed in ped[[col_spec]].

    default_NA_rep

    The value to default to if NAs are encountered. The default is NULL.

    NA_Ok

    A logical value indicating whether NAs can be present in ped[[col_spec]]. The default is TRUE.

    vec

    A vector. The default is NULL. If vec is not NULL, the function will check vec instead of ped[[col_spec]].

    force_NA

    A logical value indicating whether non-permissible should be replaced with NAs. The default is TRUE.

    force_remove

    A logical value indicating whether non-permissible values should be removed. The default is FALSE.

    Value

    The vector ped[[col_spec]] (or vec if vec is not NULL) with non-permissible values either removed and replaced.

    Contents

    Developed by BayesMendel Lab, Theo Huang, Gavin Lee, Jane Liang, Tom Madsen, Qing Zhang.
